title: Freeveto
author: Freeveto
content: The increasing technology which we see today as beneficial to us also pose some risk to crypto holders.The text prediction feature  in our Smartphones could lead to stealing your Cryptos if proper cautionare not taken.                        "AI TEXT PREDICTION " Text prediction in our Smartphones help us predict or guess the next word we're typing......Therefore this feature can easily guess a crypto holders seed phrase by just typing in one word and the text prediction can be able to bring out the whole seeds phrase of that wallet.This is as a result that we have all those data collected, that's the reason it's able to know exactly what you're looking for. RISK FACTOR  ASSOCIATED WITH AI TEXT PREDICTION COMES VIA WHEN.Your phone is stolen by another crypto holder..You sell your phone to someone without erasing your data..You gifted your phone out to Loved one ,a friend or family member without flashing your entire phone.Therefore hackers could use this feature to drain a crypto user’s funds by just easily typing in the first word phrase and the text prediction will complete the wallet's seed phrase.  WHAT TO DO                             The solution to this is to ensure you clean up your AI predictive type catch so that those data is not stored in there,  in case a senario where your phone got stolen or gets into  a wrong hand.https://cointelegraph.com/news/warning-smartphone-text-prediction-guesses-crypto-hodler-s-seed-phrase￼

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Seed phrase comprises of a lot of words, though AI predictive can catch some words still its hard to get all words, especially those AI predictive program can only rrcognize those words continously being used unless the hacker can see the history of written words in your phone. Probably someone might try it but its not an easy as you think mate.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: AI is one innovation that have helped to make the use of electronic input devices so easy and life better for any one trying to have first fingers. This is a case to be armed for sure but, only for those that do input there seed phrases more regular than required. This is what makes me doubt the chances for which, these phrases could be reproduced. There are very few instances where one needs to use a seed phrases, * Wallet creation* Wallet recoveryAside from these two instances, there is virtually no reason as I see it, for one to be playing about with his or her seed phrase, making the instances of the AI program to clinge unto the phrases a task not to remember as, they aren't used regularly. Again, these AI programs focuses on words that are grammatical enough to make a sense and not  phrases that doesn't make a complete sense.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Good grief.A wallet app that shows the seed phrase in cleartext is broken by design, as these should be using password inputs which do not have AI text prediction.So what if the user can't see the words they're typing. They have ostensibly wrote it down on paper anyway so should have an offline copy anyway.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: Freeveto on June 16, 2022, 11:56:43 AM                   The solution to this is to ensure you clean up your AI predictive type catch so that those data is not stored in there,  in case a senario where your phone got stolen or gets into  a wrong hand.The main culprit is using the default app/configuration of a mobile keyboard:QuoteAndre’s experiments confirmed that Google’s GBoard was the least vulnerable, as the software did not predict every word in the correct order. However, Microsoft’s Swiftkey keyboard was able to predict the seed phrase right out of the box. The Samsung keyboard, too, can predict the words if “auto-replace” and “suggest text corrections” have been manually turned on. The article suggests clearing up the keyboard predictive cache, but I'm sure that wouldn't solve the problem either. It's better for people who use mobile wallets should choose an alternative keyboard app that they can fully control: Android Keyboard Alternatives That Respect Your Privacy.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: It doesn't necessarily need to be AI, your keyboard app just needs to be decently bad privacy-wise for you to get screwed.I really don't care though, as I only have like $50 on my hot wallets, then everything else on cold storage. Hardware wallets, people!

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: I don't have any issue here, and I don't find this that much risky. I always copy and paste them in my smartphone. It is hard to remember the whole 12/24 word seed phrase late alone type them frequently. As far as I know, the AI won't pick up the next word pattern if you don't use them frequently. It will always be on risk if you keep your assets in one wallet, if it's not a hardware wallet. Get yourself one of those and be risk free.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: The news came out around a month and a half ago, which doesn’t make any less necessary to revisit. If one has got time, it’s generally better to go to the horse’s mouth, and read through the reddit post that depicts the case scenarios that were used to reproduce the situation, and points to a couple of links that show how to clear the predictive typing cache.It does make one wonder whether this predictive process is performed locally, or sent to some server under any circumstances...

comments.author: Anonylz
comments.body: I think as you continue to type new words with your keyboard those previous words will be pushed back or got mixed up (if not removed after some days) so it will be hard to guess and have the complete phrase imo. It will be equally important to occasionally clear the cache of the keyboard as suggested above, this is easier said than done, I really don't think I have done that before but now it is something I will take note of.

comments.author: AakZaki
comments.body: The AI ​​Text prediction will indeed read every word you want to type, but that doesn't mean it will be able to transcribe and arrange the seed phrases, it's still quite difficult. All keyboards have this feature, you can turn it off easily so no data is read.If you are worried that the data on your smartphone will be known or hacked by others, pay attention to smartphone security and reset the smartphone if you want to give it to someone else or want to sell it.Wallets in smartphone apps are all vulnerable to eavesdropping, which is safer to use hardware wallets with double security and hard to hack.

comments.author: franky1
comments.created_time: June 17, 2022, 01:40:58 AMLast edit: June 17, 2022, 01:57:16 AM by franky1
comments.body: if i wrote gui.. text prediction may predict guitar.. (or guilt, guide)(guitar and guilt are seed words but guides, guidance, guitars, guilty, guild, guile, guiro, guise. and others are not)so typing in 3 letters gui gives a 33% chance predictionso typing in 4 letters guit gives a 100% chance prediction for guitar being the wordbut it cant predict the next 11 wordsto be fair, type in any 4 letter word and manually by hand you can predict the word.. (not all 12 just the particular word).. why you may ask? because thats how the seed word library is set up.. no 2 words seeds have the first 5 letters that are the same. the library excludes many words that appear too similar.it cant predict 12 completely random words, that do not make sense to each other (do not form a common sentence)yes it can predict a single seed word if you have only typed in 3 letters at ~33-50% accuracy. or 100% at 4 lettersAI text prediction is only good at multiple words.. if..  after you have wrote a few words of some popular sentences/quotes it will tell you how the popular saying ends. but hackers wont use text prediction as a tool for seed sniffing.. they will just use screenshot software to take pictures of your display every X seconds or use key loggers.

comments.author: kaseygriffin
comments.body: As far as I understand, the way this modern technology spots seeds is like a game of chance with huge odds. It's like a random person buying a winning lottery ticket, thinking it's going to win, and as it turns out, it's much more difficult than that. So I'm also a bit skeptical about whether we need to worry about these things or not, or whether fear is so overwhelming in our minds that it will come faster than usual.

comments.author: fullhdpixel
comments.body: Quote from: Freeveto on June 16, 2022, 11:56:43 AMRISK FACTOR  ASSOCIATED WITH AI TEXT PREDICTION COMES VIA WHEN.Your phone is stolen by another crypto holder..You sell your phone to someone without erasing your data..You gifted your phone out to Loved one ,a friend or family member without flashing your entire phone.Therefore hackers could use this feature to drain a crypto user’s funds by just easily typing in the first word phrase and the text prediction will complete the wallet's seed phrase.  WHAT TO DO   If your phone is stolen, how can they open it when it's locked? And most phones now are strict and cant be easily re formatted. There's also a wipe data feature that we can use in case you are sure that your phone is stolen intentionally and won't be returned anymore and who sells his phone without erasing all his data?If we gifted the phone to the people that we know, I don't think they will attempt to stole your cryptos. Hackers will still have a hard time to guess the first word of our seed phrase. Overall in order to be safe from all of these, it is better to not store your seed phrases on your phone but it's already advised before. Seed phrases must be stored only offline and on secured places.
